title: I can't compile C++ files
author: Vadimatorik

comments.body:
This looks like scons complaining about an error in the argument to g++.
Can you provide more logs or a complete project for us to analyze?

You can use the example for tests: "\example\get-started\hello_world\rtt". Here is an example of a full build log:
```
Vadim@VPC C:\proj\sifli_sdk\example\get-started\hello_world\rtt\project
> scons --board=eh-lb523 -j12
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
Board: eh-lb523_hcpu
========
Multi-Project Info
--------
full_name       main.bootloader
parent          main
bsp_root        C:\proj\sifli_sdk\example\boot_loader\project\butterflmicro\ram_v2
build_dir       build_eh-lb523_hcpu/bootloader
link_script     C:/proj/sifli_sdk/example/boot_loader/project/butterflmicro/ram_v2\link
ptab            C:/proj/sifli_sdk/customer/boards/eh-lb523\ptab.json
embedded:       False
--------
full_name       main
parent
bsp_root        C:\proj\sifli_sdk\example\get-started\hello_world\rtt\project
build_dir       build_eh-lb523_hcpu/
link_script     C:/proj/sifli_sdk/drivers/cmsis/sf32lb52x/Templates/arm/HCPU/link
ptab            C:/proj/sifli_sdk/customer/boards/eh-lb523\ptab.json
--------

parent          main
bsp_root        C:\proj\sifli_sdk\example\flash_table\sf32lb52x_common_v2

link_script     C:/proj/sifli_sdk/example/flash_table/sf32lb52x_common_v2\link
ptab            C:/proj/sifli_sdk/customer/boards/eh-lb523\ptab.json
embedded:       False
========

```
This also seems to be a build system issue that we will fix in the next release version. I'll sync with you when there's new news

hi @Vadimatorik, please modify SConstruct as below, i.e. change `CCFLAGS=rtconfig.CFLAGS` to `CFLAGS=rtconfig.CFLAGS` 

```python
env = Environment(tools = ['mingw'],
    AS = rtconfig.AS, ASFLAGS = rtconfig.AFLAGS,
    CC = rtconfig.CC, CFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
    CXX = rtconfig.CXX, CXXFLAGS = rtconfig.CXXFLAGS,
    AR = rtconfig.AR, ARFLAGS = '-rc',
    LINK = rtconfig.LINK, LINKFLAGS = rtconfig.LFLAGS)
```

It works, thanks. If anyone else encounters this problem, here are my changes:
```bash
-    CC = rtconfig.CC, CCFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
+    CC = rtconfig.CC, CFLAGS = rtconfig.CFLAGS,
```
I think this should be fixed in the SDK examples in the future

satisfaction_conditions: A working configuration for building C++ files in the project
Correct parameter naming in the build system configuration
Clear instructions on what changes to make to the build configuration
Information that could be applied to the specific SDK being used

title: Deprecated parameter "BSP_USING_MOTOR"
body:
In my project I use a vibration motor. I thought that this module creates a rhythmic pattern. However, this parameter is not used at all:
```bash
> grep -nR "BSP_USING_MOTOR" *
customer/boards/Kconfig_drv:1691:    config BSP_USING_MOTOR
```

author: Vadimatorik

comments.body:
currently，there is not the demo code for the vibration moto work as a rhythmic pattern, you may refer to the pwm demo code  to finish it.
example\rt_device\pwm\project or \example\hal\pwm\project

Thanks for the answer) I think that in this case, it is better to remove this item for now. It is confusing)

I used the example `customer\peripherals\vibrator` for this task. This uses the system timer, but for my task it was enough.

satisfaction_conditions: Clarification about the purpose and implementation status of the BSP_USING_MOTOR parameter
Alternative approaches for implementing vibration motor functionality
Feedback acknowledgment regarding confusing/unused configuration options
